description: Using methods from public health and literary studies, students critically analyze the role of
storytelling in medical encounters. In reflection papers and close-readings, students ask how
memoir, film, and poetry highlight the layers of meaning and power dynamics that doctors and
patients navigate. Students also volunteer with community partners to create quilts and bandages
for hospitals and package them with other medical supplies, telling their own stories about the
experience. Offered periodically in January term. Prerequisite: WRIT 120 or equivalent.
